name: Battles of Lexington and Concord
significance: First battles of the Revolutionary War
description: British forces raiding Concord driven back into Boston with heavy losses

name: Battle of Bunker Hill
significance: Demonstrated American ability to stand against regular troops
description: British drive American forces from Charlestown peninsula but suffer heavy losses

name: Battle of Trenton
significance: Boosted American morale after crossing Delaware
description: Washington's surprise attack captures Hessian detachment
theater: New York and New Jersey Campaign

name: Battle of Saratoga
significance: Convinced France to join the war
description: British under Burgoyne forced to surrender; brings France into war

name: Siege of Yorktown
significance: Final major battle; led to British surrender
description: Cornwallis surrenders his entire force; last major land battle
